revised_title: Synthesis and Properties of New Poly-Ammonias from Aniline and Bichloride of Carbon
tldr: The author, A. W. Hofmann, investigates the reaction between aniline and bichloride of carbon, resulting in the formation of a new base. The new base, which can be used as a colorant, is synthesized through a complex process involving multiple steps and chemical transformations. The author also discusses the constitution of the new compound and its relation to other phenyl-based diamines.
